entities.name: gringotts
entities.description: Gringotts is a location mentioned in the text as the entrance to which has been replaced by two wizards. It is described as having bronze doors leading to an inner hall.

relationships.description: Travers is at Gringotts, as he is standing in front of the entrance and looking through the bronze doors.
Hermione is also at Gringotts, as she is climbing the steps to enter the location.
Travers uses Probity Probes, which are described as crude but effective tools for detecting spells of concealment and hidden magical objects.
Hermione is imitating Bellatrix's commanding and arrogant voice when speaking to the guard at Gringotts.
Travers employs guards, who are equipped with Probity Probes and are tasked with detecting spells of concealment and hidden magical objects.
